reviews.text: A great location in Paris. The hotel is a small inn. Our room was in the front with windows on the street. This is a very busy street (some called it an alley) and it was loud all night long. I liked the uniqueness of the hotel. It is not quite as elegant as in the pictures, but it is still a very nice hotel. We did have a confusing discussion with one of the front desk persons over whether or not there was a second bed in the room. He insisted there were two beds in the room. We jokingly went upstairs and started looking in drawers and closets to find the second bed. That was very strange. Never went to the lounge or the courtyard. Too busy out in St Germain.
reviews.title: Really just average but the location makes it Really Good!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just stayed at this hotel (Feb 2012) and it was absolutely lovely. The staff was friendly and welcoming. We loved our room - very cute and good on space. My only wish would be for better beds. But we were fine for a long weekend stay.
reviews.title: Quite and Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was great as well. Easy to get to get there from St Michel station. And we were in the heart of a lovely district full of shops, galleries, and cafes.
reviews.title: Perfect stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great and a small walk from Notre Dame. The neighbourhood around is also great for walking around shops and paris streets.
reviews.title: Great Location But That's About It

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In short, very much not worth the money. Especially since Paris has a great Metro which will only cost you €1.70 to get across town in a few minutes. You'll have to travel around to see the other sites and such anyway. Really not worth it.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the rest, the place is literally falling apart. The room is multiple levels, which is quite neat. However, pushing slightly on a railing, it came apart. If a child had done that they would have had quite the fall.
reviews.title: perfect location, great staff

reviews.text: A night the room is very bright so you need a face mask if you hope to sleep, and it can be quite loud. The bed was also quite uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Comfortable. Great location.

reviews.text: WIFI will cost you €15 on top of everything.
reviews.title: Nice and Quiet, very near the heart of the Latin Quarter

reviews.text: Booked 4 nights over Easter. On arrival we registered and were told where our rooms were (1 superior double on the 4th floor and 1 superior twin on the 6th floor). Having deposited our luggage the receptionist then said "oh I forgot to mention we have building works" - yes, we'd heard them. There was no air conditioning throughout our stay (the builders had apparently cut through it). The courtyard where we were hoping to relax during the day was unavailable because of the building works. The "superior rooms" were tired, the paintwork was chipped and dirty, matresses worn and bathrooms were dirty with a cracked sink in the 6th floor room, but I have to say the staff were always pleasant until the last day when they presented the bill offering to take 30 euros off one room because my pregnant daughter had complained she could not sleep on the first night because of the lack of air conditioning. After further embarrassing complaining they reduced the bill by 20 euros a night, saying that we should have checked to see if they had building works on before we arrived. Of course, it's usual practice to phone up a hotel just to check if they have the builders in, is it not?
reviews.title: You're paying for the location

reviews.text: This charming hotel has all the typically French touches you would expect. Impeccable service, classic rooms with modern batrooms and mock Jean Louis 16th furniture, balconies, teracces and comfortable beds. The staff were friendly and accomodating - I got stuck there over the 'Volcano' incident and they happily obliged me another 3 nights stay. When I checked in again they even gave me the same room I had on request. I had my own courtyard - lovely!
reviews.title: Charming Parisian hotel in eautful district of Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a small hotel in an old building in one of the most interesting areas of Paris. There are many great bars, restaurants and art galleries within a few minutes' walk.
reviews.title: Excellent central location, quiet bedroom
A "prince" of a hotel
reviews.text: We only stayed one night in a standard room. We could have done with a bed that was a bit longer and wider (and neither of us is a giant) but it was comfortable and very quiet. We were overlooking a central courtyrard, not the street.
We didn't take breakfast there so can't comment on that. We found the female receptionist polite and helpful.
reviews.title: Good location but not worth the money

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Prince de Conti three times over the last 12 years. I almost gave the property an average because I love the location so much but I couldn't justify it. The property is VERY tired. One could call it shabby chic, but I don't think most people rent a hotel room to look at peeling wallpaper (in the room as well as the stairway to the breakfast room). The stained carpets need to be changed and the dark green paint in the hallways also needs to be redone. The reception is just fair. The layout of the property is lovely, but better use of the open courtyard is recommended. The little private patio our traveling companions had also stored the hotel's potting soil! On the positive side the place is clean and the bathrooms are nice. In the past, I have been very happy there, I hope Prince de Conti can regain my business, but won't stay there again until I learn it has been renovated.
reviews.title: Very tired

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great little hotel in a fantastic location! literally 2 mins walk to the Seine in one direction and straight into the cafes and streets of St Germain in the other direction. We had requested a ground floor room with bath as my husband is in a wheelchair - the room was small but manageable and the decor is fantastic.
reviews.title: Fantastic location in Paris

reviews.text: We thought breakfast at 12Euro was steep but after stopping at a cafe the first day where a coffee, juice and a croissant was 8Euro we decided to have breakfast at the hotel after that! Would definately stay here again for the location. Staff very friendly and helpful as well.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was nice. The room was on the ground floor (room 1), and it was quite large with a separate toilet and bathroom. There are pictures of the bathroom on tripadvisor - it is the one with the multi coloured tiles.
reviews.title: very nice quaint hotel in St. Germaine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was standard continental fare, with cheese, meat, bread, cereal and fruit.
reviews.title: Terrific location and very nice hotel
